description: A group of inflammatory conditions of the gastrointestinal tract, primarily including Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.
A type of inflammatory bowel disease that can affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract.
A chronic disease characterized by inflammation of the colon and rectum.
A therapeutic approach that targets multiple pathways in the treatment of inflammatory bowel disease.

entity_name: Therapeutic Agents Targeting Cellular Signaling Pathways
description: A category of therapeutic agents designed to target cellular signaling mechanisms in the treatment of IBD.
A category of therapeutic agents aimed at influencing leukocyte movement in inflammatory conditions.
Therapeutic agents that act through Janus kinase pathways, involved in cellular signaling.
Agents that exert therapeutic effects through mechanisms that do not involve Janus kinases.
